other_tests.findings: Sensory and motor responses were normal and symmetric; Hoffman's reflex was absent at the left soleus; electromyography of the left leg showed diminished recruitment of long-duration, polyphasic motor-unit potentials.

Oligoclonal banding was not present; cytologic studies showed increased lymphocytes that were polymorphous and occasionally reactive; immunophenotypic evaluation did not reveal evidence of a monoclonal B-cell or unusual T-cell population.
Asymmetric attenuation in the amplitudes of sensory and motor responses; no evidence of primary demyelination; electromyography showed abnormal spontaneous activity in multiple muscles.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Substantial deterioration had occurred since the initial study.

other_tests.findings: Protein level of 4620 mg per deciliter, glucose level lower than 2 mg per deciliter; abundant lymphocytes that were polymorphous, enlarged, reactive, and atypical.
Marked increase in cellularity; infiltration by neoplastic lymphocytes; immunohistochemical staining confirmed the population was lymphocytic with large neoplastic lymphocytes.
